pullRequest.title: Adds new creation methods for MutableVirtualFile to offer a safe variant

commit.message:
Adds new creation methods for MutableVirtualFile to offer a safe variant

Fixes: OX-5616

Removes public access to the MutableVirtualFile Constructor

Fixes: OX-5616

nodes.bodyText:
Do we need to make sure these file names are also Windows-compatible? If so, we should include a few more characters to the list.

Linux/Unix: / (forward slash)
Windows: < (less than) > (greater than) : (colon - sometimes works, but is actually NTFS Alternate Data Streams) " (double quote) / (forward slash) \ (backslash) | (vertical bar or pipe) ? ( question mark) * (asterisk)

commit.message:
Adds a another method for unsafe file creations

Fixes: OX-5616

Replaces more illegal chars

Fixes: OX-5616

Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/master' into meg/OX-5616

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/sirius/biz/storage/layer3/uplink/ftp/FTPUplink.java
#	src/main/java/sirius/biz/storage/layer3/uplink/sftp/SFTPUplink.java

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the given name is empty or contains an illegal char
          
          
            
                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the given name is empty or contains an {@link #REGEX_ILLEGAL_FILE_CHARS illegal} char

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Replaces any illegal chars in the given String and if the given String is empty, <tt>null</tt> is returned.
          
          
            
                 * Replaces any {@link #REGEX_ILLEGAL_FILE_CHARS illegal} chars in the given String and if the given String is empty, <tt>null</tt> is returned.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * or {@link #safeCreate(VirtualFile, String)} to account for illegal characters.
          
          
            
                 * or {@link #safeCreate(VirtualFile, String)} to account for {@link #REGEX_ILLEGAL_FILE_CHARS illegal} characters.
